title: How to Remove Bing from Windows, Mac, & Mobile: 10 Ways

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. If you use Google Chrome on your computer and don't want to see Bing anymore, you can use this method to remove it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu and select Settings . You'll see the three-dot menu at the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click the Search Engine tab.
steps.content: Click the Search Engine tab. It's on the left panel.

steps.title: Change your search engine to something other than Bing.
steps.content: Change your search engine to something other than Bing. If Bing is your current search engine , you'll see "Microsoft Bing" here. To change it, click Change , then select an alternative like Google, DuckDuckGo, or Yandex.

steps.title: Click the On startup tab.
steps.content: Click the On startup tab. It's on the left panel. Now you'll see which page(s) open when you launch Chrome.

steps.title: Select an option other than the Bing homepage.
steps.content: Select an option other than the Bing homepage. If the current option is "Open a specific page or set of pages" and you see a page that has "Bing" or "Microsoft" in the address, click the three-dot menu next to the address and select Remove . To use the default Chrome startup tab, select Open the New Tab page . Alternatively, you can choose Continue where you left off to reopen any pages you had open when you closed Chrome.

steps.title: Click the Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Extensions tab. It's on the left panel. If you have any Bing extensions, such as Microsoft Bing with Search Rewards or Microsoft Bing Homepage & Search, you can disable them here.

steps.title: Remove all Bing-related extensions.
steps.content: Remove all Bing-related extensions. To remove an extension, click Remove beneath its name, then click Remove to confirm.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. If your default search engine in Chrome is set to Bing, you can change it to a different search engine easily.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings . This opens your Chrome settings.

steps.title: Tap Search engine.
steps.content: Tap Search engine . Your default search engine appears here. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select a search engine other than Bing.
steps.content: Select a search engine other than Bing. If you want to switch to Google or DuckDuckGo , choose your preferred option from the menu.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. If you use Edge on your computer and don't want to use Bing, you can change your search engine, set a new start page, and remove any Bing-related extensions.

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu and select Settings . You'll see the menu at the top-right corner of Edge.

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . This tab is in the left panel.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Address bar and search.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Address bar and search . You'll see this at the bottom of the right panel.

steps.title: Select an option from "Search engine used in the address bar."
steps.content: Select an option from "Search engine used in the address bar." If Bing is your default search engine, select a different option (such as Google or DuckDuckGo ) from the menu. If you have the Microsoft Rewards extension installed, you can't change your search engine to anything but Bing unless you turn off the extension. Click the Turn Off button to disable the extension, and you'll then be able to choose a different search engine.

steps.title: Click Start, home, and new tabs.
steps.content: Click Start, home, and new tabs . This tab is in the left panel.

steps.title: Select a new page under "When Edge starts."
steps.content: Select a new page under "When Edge starts." When you launch Edge, your default startup page opens automatically. If you don't want to see Bing, you'll need to set a specific page to open instead. To do this: Select Open these pages . If there's a website listed, click its three-dot menu and select Delete . Click Add a new page . Enter a URL, such as https://wikihow.com and click Add .

steps.title: Remove Bing extensions.
steps.content: Remove Bing extensions. If you have any extensions installed, such as Microsoft Rewards, you can disable them to prevent Bing from resetting to your default search engine. Here's how: Click the three-dot menu and select Extensions . Click Manage Extensions . Look for any Microsoft or Bing extensions. If you see one, click Remove and select Remove to confirm.

steps.title: Open Safari on your Mac.
steps.content: Open Safari on your Mac. It's the blue-and-white compass icon on the Dock. Use this method if you want to search the web using a search engine other than Bing in Safari on your computer.

steps.title: Click the magnifying glass in the search/address bar.
steps.content: Click the magnifying glass in the search/address bar. You'll see this bar at the top of Safari. A list of search engines will appear. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select an option that isn't Bing.
steps.content: Select an option that isn't Bing. You can select Google , DuckDuckGo , or your preferred search engine.

steps.title: Click the Safari menu.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu. It's in the menu bar at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Click Settings on the menu. Your Safari settings will appear. [4] X Research source If you don't see this option, click Preferences instead. If opening Settings doesn't take you to the General tab, click General now.

steps.title: Use a startup page that isn't Bing.
steps.content: Use a startup page that isn't Bing. If you see a web address that contains "Microsoft" or "Bing" in the "Homepage" bar, or simply any address you don't recognize, replace it with your preferred startup page. For example, if you'd rather use Google, you'd type https://www.google.com .

steps.title: Click the Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Extensions tab. You'll see it at the top of the Settings panel.

steps.title: Remove Bing-related extensions.
steps.content: Remove Bing-related extensions. If there is a Bing extension installed, such as "Microsoft Bing for Safari," "Bing Redirect," or "Microsoft Start," select it, then click Uninstall . This removes Bing from Safari. [5] X Research source While you're in the Extensions area, look for any other extensions you don't recognize. Some forms of malware install extensions that will automatically restore Bing back to Safari. Delete all extensions you don't recognize to be on the safe side. If you continue to see Bing in Safari after making these changes, your Mac may be infected with Bing Redirect malware. Scan your Mac for viruses malware using a free tool like Malwarebytes or ClamXav to remove it.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings . You'll find this gray gear icon on your home screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps (on iOS 18 and later).
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps (on iOS 18 and later). It's at the bottom of the Settings menu. You can skip this step if you haven't updated to iOS 18.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari .

steps.title: Tap Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Search Engine . It's the first option under "SEARCH."

steps.title: Tap an option other than Bing.
steps.content: Tap an option other than Bing. For example, tap Google if you want your default search engine to be Google. The change will take effect immediately.

steps.title: Delete the Bing app or Microsoft Start app (if installed).
steps.content: Delete the Bing app or Microsoft Start app (if installed). Both of these apps may lead to Bing opening up on your iPhone or iPad. To check for these apps: On your home screen, swipe left until you see the App Library screen. Tap the App Library search bar at the top. Type Bing to search. If it appears, tap and hold its icon, select Delete app , then choose Delete' . Once deleted, search for Microsoft . If you see it, tap and hold its icon, and select Delete app > Delete .

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings.
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings. If you don't want Bing wallpapers to appear on your desktop, you can turn off Windows Spotlight on your desktop and lock screen. To open Windows Settings, press the Windows key on the keyboard and click Settings or the gear icon.

steps.title: Click Personalization.
steps.content: Click Personalization . Your Windows personalization preferences will appear.

steps.title: Click Background.
steps.content: Click Background . This displays your background settings.

steps.title: Select a background option that isn't "Windows Spotlight."
steps.content: Select a background option that isn't "Windows Spotlight." You can opt for a picture, a solid color, or a slideshow. As long as you don't use Windows Spotlight, you won't have Bing Wallpaper on your desktop. Click the back button when you are finished.

steps.title: Click Lock Screen.
steps.content: Click Lock Screen . If Bing Wallpaper is set as your lock screen background, you'll see "Windows Spotlight."

steps.title: Select an option other than "Windows Spotlight."
steps.content: Select an option other than "Windows Spotlight." Changing your lock screen background to another option disables Bing Wallpaper.

steps.title: If that didn't work, try this:
steps.content: If that didn't work, try this: Press Windows key + R . Type appwiz.cpl and press Enter . Look for '"Bing Wallpaper" or "Microsoft Bing Service" and remove them.

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. If you're using Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7, or Windows Vista, you can uninstall Bing Desktop to remove the Bing toolbar from Windows. [6] X Research source If you're using Windows 8.1, swipe in from the right to open the Charms menu, click Settings , and then click Control Panel . Using Windows 7 and earlier, click the Start menu and select Control Panel .

steps.title: Click Uninstall a program or Programs and Features.
steps.content: Click Uninstall a program or Programs and Features . You'll find one of these options in the Control Panel. A window that has all your installed programs will load.

steps.title: Select Bing Desktop or Bing Bar in the list.
steps.content: Select Bing Desktop or Bing Bar in the list. This highlights the option.

steps.title: Click Uninstall or Remove.
steps.content: Click Uninstall or Remove . You'll see one of these buttons near the top of the list. A confirmation will appear.

steps.title: Click Yes.
steps.content: Click Yes . This removes the Bing Toolbar or Bing Desktop from your computer.

steps.title: Open the Registry Editor.
steps.content: Open the Registry Editor. To do so, press Windows key + S , type regedit , then click Registry Editor . Microsoft has technically removed the option to disable Bing search results in the Windows search bar. If you're still opposed to seeing Bing results in your Windows searches, you can edit the registry . This is not recommended by Microsoft, but it's still possible if you're not afraid to make registry changes.

steps.title: Go to "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows."
steps.content: Go to "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows." You can do this by typing or pasting that address into the address bar at the top of Registry Editor and pressing Enter .

steps.title: Double-click CurrentVersion.
steps.content: Double-click CurrentVersion . You're almost there!

steps.title: Double-click Search.
steps.content: Double-click Search . You should now see some options in the right panel.

steps.title: Right-click a blank area of the right panel.
steps.content: Right-click a blank area of the right panel. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Select New and click D-WORD (32-bit).
steps.content: Select New and click D-WORD (32-bit) . This create a new key.

steps.title: Type BingSearchEnabled and hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type BingSearchEnabled and hit ↵ Enter . The new key is now created.

steps.title: Double-click BingSearchEnabled.
steps.content: Double-click BingSearchEnabled . This opens the details of your new key.

steps.title: Type a zero into the data field and click OK.
steps.content: Type a zero into the data field and click OK . If the value was already zero, there's no need to change anything. This is all you'll need to do to remove Bing from Windows Search. Restart your PC when you're finished so the changes will take effect.

steps.title: Open the Registry Editor.
steps.content: Open the Registry Editor. To do so, press Windows key + S , type regedit , then click Registry Editor . While Microsoft doesn't give you an easy way to turn off Bing search suggestions when you use the Windows 11 search bar, you can disable these suggestions in your registry. This method is not recommended by Microsoft, but it should work to make your Windows 11 search bar stop searching the web with Bing.

steps.title: Go to the Explorer registry key.
steps.content: Go to the Explorer registry key. To get there, type or paste this address into the bar at the top of Registry Editor, then press Enter : HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer

steps.title: Create a new DWORD.
steps.content: Create a new DWORD. Here's how: Right-click an empty area on the right side of the panel. Select New . Click DWORD (32-bit) Value .

steps.title: Type DisableSearchBoxSuggestions and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type DisableSearchBoxSuggestions and press ↵ Enter . You should now see a new option called DisableSearchBoxSuggestions in the right panel.

steps.title: Double-click DisableSearchBoxSuggestions.
steps.content: Double-click DisableSearchBoxSuggestions . This opens the Edit DWORD box.

steps.title: Type a 1 into the "Value data" field and click OK.
steps.content: Type a 1 into the "Value data" field and click OK .

steps.title: Restart your PC.
steps.content: Restart your PC. Once you restart, you should no longer see Bing suggestions in the Windows 11 search bar. Microsoft may get rid of this workaround in a future update, but it should work for now.

steps.title: Open the Registry Editor.
steps.content: Open the Registry Editor. If you don't want to see Bing Chat at the top-right corner of Microsoft Edge, you can do a quick registry hack to remove it. To open the registry, press Windows key + S , type regedit , then click Registry Editor . Doing this fix will remove the entire Bing sidebar from the right side of Edge, restoring it to a more Chrome-like experience. This fix may be undone by Microsoft in a future update, but it should work in both Windows 10 and Windows 11 for now.

steps.title: Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft.
steps.content: Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft . To do this, type or paste that address into the address bar at the top of the Registry Editor, then press Enter .

steps.title: Create a new key called Edge.
steps.content: Create a new key called Edge. First, if you already see a folder called Edge in the left panel under "Microsoft," you can skip this step. But if you don't, here's how to create it: Right-click a blank area of the right panel. Select New > Key . Type Edge and press Enter . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click Edge in the left panel.
steps.content: Right-click Edge in the left panel. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Create a new DWORD called HubsSidebarEnabled.
steps.content: Create a new DWORD called HubsSidebarEnabled. Here's how: Right-click Edge in the left panel. Select New > DWORD (32-bit) Value . Name the new DWORD HubsSidebarEnabled and press Enter . Double-click HubsSidebarEnabled and make sure there is a 0 in the "Value data" field. If not, replace the current number with 0 and click OK .

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge and go to edge://policy.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge and go to edge://policy . You can do this by typing or pasting that address into the address bar and pressing Enter .

steps.title: Click the Reload Policies button.
steps.content: Click the Reload Policies button. This disables the sidebar and the Bing Chat icon. If you change your mind and want to bring Bing Chat and the sidebar back: Return to the Registry Editor. Go to Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge Double-click HubsSidebarEnabled and change the "0" to "1." Click OK . Go to edge://policy in Microsoft Edge. Click Reload Policies .
